 1632: kex_error(Config) ->
 1633:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1634:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1635:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1636:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1637:     [Kex1,Kex2|_] = proplists:get_value(kex, ssh:default_algorithms()),
 1638:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1639:                                               {user_dir, UserDir},
 1640:                                               {password, "morot"},
 1641:                                               {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[Kex1]}]}
 1642:                                              ]),
 1643:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1644:     ok = ssh_log_h:add_fun(kex_error,
 1645:                            fun(#{msg:={report,#{format:=Fmt,args:=As,label:={error_logger,_}}}}, Pid) ->
 1646:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1647:                                    Pid ! {Ref, lists:flatten(io_lib:format(Fmt,As))};
 1648:                               (_,Pid) ->
 1649:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1650:                                    ok % Other msg
 1651:                            end,
 1652:                            self()),
 1653:     try
 1654:         ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1655:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1656:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1657:                                           {user_interaction, false},
 1658:                                           {user_dir, UserDir},
 1659:                                           {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[Kex2]}]}
 1660:                                          ])
 1661:     of
 1662:         _ ->
 1663:             ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1664:             ct:fail("expected failure", [])
 1665:     catch
 1666:         error:{badmatch,{error,"Key exchange failed"}} ->
 1667:             %% ok
 1668:             receive
 1669:                 {Ref, ErrMsgTxt} ->
 1670:                     ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1671:                     ct:log("ErrMsgTxt = ~n~s", [ErrMsgTxt]),
 1672:                     Lines = lists:map(fun string:trim/1, string:tokens(ErrMsgTxt, "\n")),
 1673:                     OK = (lists:all(fun(S) -> lists:member(S,Lines) end,
 1674:                                     ["Disconnects with code = 3 [RFC4253 11.1]: Key exchange failed",
 1675:                                      "Details:",
 1676:                                      "No common key exchange algorithm,",
 1677:                                      "we have:",
 1678:                                      "peer have:"]) andalso
 1679:                           string:find(ErrMsgTxt, atom_to_list(Kex1)) =/= nomatch andalso
 1680:                           string:find(ErrMsgTxt, atom_to_list(Kex2)) =/= nomatch),
 1681:                     case OK of
 1682:                         true ->
 1683:                             ok;
 1684:                         false ->
 1685:                             ct:fail("unexpected error text msg", [])
 1686:                     end
 1687:             after 20000 ->
 1688:                     ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1689:                     ct:fail("timeout", [])
 1690:             end;
 1691: 
 1692:         error:{badmatch,{error,_}} ->
 1693:             ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1694:             ct:fail("unexpected error msg", [])
 1695:     end.
 1696: 
 1697: stop_listener(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1698:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1699:     %% to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1700:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey),
 1701:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1702:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1703: 
 1704:     {Pid0, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1705: 					      {user_dir, UserDir},
 1706: 					      {password, "morot"},
 1707: 					      {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1708: 
 1709:     ConnectionRef0 = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port,
 1710:                                           [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1711:                                            {user, "foo"},
 1712:                                            {password, "morot"},
 1713:                                            {user_interaction, false},
 1714:                                            {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1715:     {ok, ChannelId0} =
 1716:         ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef0, infinity),
 1717: 
 1718:     ssh:stop_listener(Host, Port),
 1719: 
 1720:     {error, _} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1721:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1722:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1723: 					  {user, "foo"},
 1724: 					  {password, "morot"},
 1725: 					  {user_interaction, true},
 1726: 					  {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1727:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef0, ChannelId0,
 1728: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1729:     receive
 1730: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef0,
 1731:          {data, ChannelId0, 0, <<"echo testing\r\n">>}} ->
 1732: 	    ok
 1733:     after 5000 ->
 1734: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1735:     end,
 1736: 
 1737:     case ssh_test_lib:daemon(Port, [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1738:                                     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1739:                                     {password, "potatis"},
 1740:                                     {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]) of
 1741: 	{Pid1, Host, Port} ->
 1742: 	    ConnectionRef1 =
 1743:                 ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1744:                                                   {user, "foo"},
 1745:                                                   {password, "potatis"},
 1746:                                                   {user_interaction, true},
 1747:                                                   {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1748: 	    {error, _} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1749:                                                   {save_accepted_host, false},
 1750:                                                   {user, "foo"},
 1751:                                                   {password, "morot"},
 1752:                                                   {user_interaction, true},
 1753:                                                   {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1754: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef0),
 1755: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef1),
 1756: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid0),
 1757: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid1);
 1758: 	Error ->
 1759: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef0),
 1760: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid0),
 1761: 	    ct:fail({unexpected, Error})
 1762:     end.
 1763: 
 1764: no_sensitive_leak(Config) ->
 1765:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1766:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1767:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1768:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1769: 
 1770:     %% Save old, and set new log level:
 1771:     #{level := Level} = logger:get_primary_config(),
 1772:     logger:set_primary_config(level, info),
 1773:     %% Define a collect fun:
 1774:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1775:     Collect = 
 1776:         fun G(N,Nf,Nt) ->
 1777:                 receive
 1778:                     {Ref, false, _} ->
 1779:                         G(N+1, Nf+1, Nt);
 1780:                     {Ref, true, R} ->
 1781:                         ct:log("Report leaked:~n~p", [R]),
 1782:                         G(N+1, Nf, Nt+1)
 1783:                 after 100 ->
 1784:                         {N, Nf, Nt}
 1785:                 end
 1786:         end,
 1787:  
 1788:     %% Install the test handler:
 1789:     Hname = no_sensitive_leak,
 1790:     ok = ssh_log_h:add_fun(Hname,
 1791:                            fun(#{msg := {report,#{report := Rep}}}, Pid) ->
 1792:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid, status) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1793:                                    Pid ! {Ref,ssh_log_h:sensitive_in_opt(Rep),Rep};
 1794:                               (_,Pid) ->
 1795:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid, status) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1796:                                    ok
 1797:                            end,
 1798:                            self()),
 1799: 
 1800:     {_Pid0, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1801: 					      {user_dir, UserDir},
 1802: 					      {password, "morot"},
 1803: 					      {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1804: 
 1805:     _ConnectionRef0 = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1806: 						       {user, "foo"},
 1807: 						       {password, "morot"},
 1808: 						       {user_interaction, true},
 1809: 						       {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1810:     %% Kill acceptor to make it restart:
 1811:     [true|_] =
 1812:         [exit(Pacc,kill) || {{ssh_system_sup,_},P1,supervisor,_} <- supervisor:which_children(sshd_sup),
 1813:                             {{ssh_acceptor_sup,_},P2,supervisor,_} <- supervisor:which_children(P1),
 1814:                             {{ssh_acceptor_sup,_},Pacc,worker,_} <- supervisor:which_children(P2)],
 1815:     
 1816:     %% Remove the test handler and reset the logger level:
 1817:     timer:sleep(500),
 1818:     logger:remove_handler(Hname),
 1819:     logger:set_primary_config(Level),
 1820: 
 1821:     case Collect(0, 0, 0) of
 1822:         {0, 0,   0} -> ct:fail("Logging failed, line = ~p", [?LINE]);
 1823:         {_, _,   0} -> ok;
 1824:         {_, _, Nt0} -> ct:fail("Leak in ~p cases!", [Nt0])
 1825:     end.
 1826:     
 1827: start_subsystem_on_closed_channel(Config) ->
 1828:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1829:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1830:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1831:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1832:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1833: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1834: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1835: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n", {ssh_echo_server, [4000000]}}]}]),
 1836: 
 1837:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1838: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1839: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1840: 						      {user_interaction, false},
 1841: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1842: 
 1843: 
 1844:     {ok, ChannelId1} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1845:     ok = ssh_connection:close(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1),
 1846:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, []),
 1847:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "echo_n", 5000),
 1848:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "testing1.\n", 5000),
 1849:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1850: 
 1851:     %% Test that there could be a gap between close and an operation (Bugfix OTP-14939):
 1852:     {ok, ChannelId2} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1853:     ok = ssh_connection:close(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2),
 1854:     timer:sleep(2000),
 1855:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, []),
 1856:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "echo_n", 5000),
 1857:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "testing1.\n", 5000),
 1858:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1859: 
 1860:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1861:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1862: 
 1863: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1864: max_channels_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1865:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1866:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1867:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1868:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1869:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1870: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1871: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1872: 					     {max_channels, 3},
 1873: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n", {ssh_echo_server, [4000000]}}]}
 1874: 					    ]),
 1875: 
 1876:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1877: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1878: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1879: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1880: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1881: 
 1882:     %% Allocate a number of ChannelId:s to play with. (This operation is not
 1883:     %% counted by the max_channel option).
 1884:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1885:     {ok, ChannelId1} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1886:     {ok, ChannelId2} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1887:     {ok, ChannelId3} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1888:     {ok, ChannelId4} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1889:     {ok, ChannelId5} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1890:     {ok, ChannelId6} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1891:     {ok, _ChannelId7} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1892: 
 1893:     %% Now start to open the channels (this is counted my max_channels) to check that
 1894:     %% it gives a failure at right place
 1895: 
 1896:     %%%---- Channel 1(3): shell
 1897:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId0),
 1898:     receive
 1899: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, <<"Eshell",_/binary>>}} ->
 1900: 	    ok
 1901:     after 5000 ->
 1902: 	    ct:fail("CLI Timeout")
 1903:     end,
 1904: 
 1905:     %%%---- Channel 2(3): subsystem "echo_n"
 1906:     success = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "echo_n", infinity),
 1907: 
 1908:     %%%---- Channel 3(3): exec. This closes itself.
 1909:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "testing1.\n", infinity),
 1910:     receive
 1911: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId2, 0, <<"testing1",_/binary>>}} ->
 1912: 	    ok
 1913:     after 5000 ->
 1914: 	    ct:fail("Exec #1 Timeout")
 1915:     end,
 1916: 
 1917:     %%%---- Channel 3(3): subsystem "echo_n" (Note that ChannelId2 should be closed now)
 1918:     ?wait_match(success, ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId3, "echo_n", infinity)),
 1919: 
 1920:     %%%---- Channel 4(3) !: exec  This should fail
 1921:     failure = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId4, "testing2.\n", infinity),
 1922: 
 1923:     %%%---- close the shell (Frees one channel)
 1924:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1925:     
 1926:     %%%---- wait for the subsystem to terminate
 1927:     receive
 1928: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef,{closed,ChannelId0}} -> ok
 1929:     after 5000 ->
 1930: 	    ct:log("Timeout waiting for '{ssh_cm,~p,{closed,~p}}'~n"
 1931: 		   "Message queue:~n~p",
 1932: 		   [ConnectionRef,ChannelId0,erlang:process_info(self(),messages)]),
 1933: 	    ct:fail("exit Timeout",[])
 1934:     end,
 1935: 
 1936:     %%---- Try that we can open one channel instead of the closed one
 1937:     ?wait_match(success, ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId5, "echo_n", infinity)),
 1938: 
 1939:     %%---- But not a fourth one...
 1940:     failure = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId6, "echo_n", infinity),
 1941: 
 1942:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1943:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1944: 
 1945: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1946: %% Internal functions ------------------------------------------------
 1947: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1948: do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef) ->
 1949:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef, 1).
 1950: 
 1951: do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef, N) ->
 1952:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1953:     Cmd = "yes testing | head -n " ++ integer_to_list(N),
 1954:     ct:log("Cmd to be invoked over SSH shell: ~p", [Cmd]),
 1955:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Cmd, infinity),
 1956:     ExpectedBin = <<"testing\n">>,
 1957:     case N of
 1958:         1 ->
 1959:             %% receive response to input
 1960:             receive
 1961:                 {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, ExpectedBin}} ->
 1962:                     ok
 1963:             after
 1964:                 10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1965:             end;
 1966:         _ ->
 1967:             receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, N * byte_size(ExpectedBin), 0)
 1968:     end,
 1969:     %% receive close messages
 1970:     CloseMessages =
 1971:         [{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}},
 1972:          {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {closed, ChannelId0}}],
 1973:     Timeout = 10000,
 1974:     [receive
 1975:          M ->
 1976:              ct:log("Received M = ~w", [M]),
 1977:              ok
 1978:      after
 1979:          Timeout ->
 1980:              ct:log("M = ~w not found !", [M]),
 1981:              ct:log("Messages in queue =~n~p", [process_info(self(), messages)]),
 1982:              ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1983:      end || M <- CloseMessages],
 1984:     receive
 1985:         %% 141 is exit status of `yes testing | head -n 1` on tcsh
 1986:         %% other shells return 0
 1987:         ExitMsg = {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, ExitStatus}}
 1988:           when ExitStatus == 0; ExitStatus == 141 ->
 1989:             ct:log("Received M = ~w", [ExitMsg]),
 1990:             ok
 1991:     after
 1992:         Timeout ->
 1993:             ct:log("Acceptable exit status not received"),
 1994:             ct:log("Messages in queue =~n~p", [process_info(self(), messages)]),
 1995:             ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1996:     end,
 1997:     ok.
 1998: 
 1999: 
 2000: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 2001: flush_msgs() ->
 2002:     flush_msgs([]).
 2003: 
 2004: flush_msgs(Unexpected) ->
 2005:     receive
 2006:         M ->
 2007:             case lists:member(M, Unexpected) of
 2008:                 true ->
 2009:                     ct:fail("Unexpected message found:  ~p", [M]);
 2010:                 _ ->
 2011:                     flush_msgs()
 2012:             end
 2013:     after
 2014:         500 -> ok
 2015:     end.
 2016: 
 2017: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 2018: test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 2019:     test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Prohibited.">>, <<"Eshell V">>).
 2020: 
 2021: test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, NotExpect) ->
 2022:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 2023:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef, ChannelId),
 2024:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 2025:     NotExpSz = size(NotExpect),
 2026:     receive
 2027:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 1, <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 2028:             flush_msgs();
 2029: 
 2030:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<NotExpect:NotExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 2031:             ct:fail("Could start disabled shell!");
 2032: 
 2033:         R ->
 2034:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 2035:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, '0|1', Expect}} ]),
 2036:             ct:fail("Strange shell response")
 2037: 
 2038:     after 5000 ->
 2039:             ct:fail("Shell Timeout")
 2040:     end.
 2041: 
 2042: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 2043: test_exec_is_disabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 2044:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 2045:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, "1+2.", infinity),
 2046:     receive
 2047:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,1,<<"Prohibited.">>}} ->
 2048:             flush_msgs();
 2049:         R ->
 2050:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 2051:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,1,<<"Prohibited.">>}} ]),
 2052:             ct:fail("Could exec erlang term although non-erlang shell")
 2053:     after 5000 ->
 2054:             ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 2055:     end.
 2056: 
 2057: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 2058: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 2059:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Eshell V">>).
 2060: 
 2061: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect) ->
 2062:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, []).
 2063: 
 2064: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, PtyOpts) ->
 2065:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 2066:     case PtyOpts of
 2067:         [] ->
 2068:             no_alloc;
 2069:         _ ->
 2070:             success = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, PtyOpts)
 2071:     end,
 2072:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId),
 2073: 
 2074:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 2075:     receive
 2076: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 2077: 	    flush_msgs();
 2078: 
 2079:         R ->
 2080:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 2081:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Expect}} ]),
 2082:             ct:fail("Strange shell response")
 2083: 
 2084:     after 5000 ->
 2085: 	    ct:fail("CLI Timeout")
 2086:     end.
 2087: 
 2088: 
 2089: test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 2090:     test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, "1+2.", <<"3">>).
 2091: 
 2092: test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Exec, Expect) ->
 2093:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 2094:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Exec, infinity),
 2095:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 2096:     receive
 2097:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0,
 2098:                                  <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} = R ->
 2099:             ct:log("~p:~p Got expected ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,R]);
 2100:         Other ->
 2101:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 2102:                    [?MODULE,?LINE, Other, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,
 2103:                                            {data, ChannelId, 0, Expect}}]),
 2104:             {fail, "Unexpected data"}
 2105:     after 5000 ->
 2106:             {fail,"Exec Timeout"}
 2107:     end.
 2108: 
 2109: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 2110: big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId) ->
 2111:     big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, []).
 2112: 
 2113: big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Acc) ->
 2114:     receive
 2115: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Data}} ->
 2116: 	    big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, [Data | Acc]);
 2117: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId}} ->
 2118: 	    {ok, iolist_to_binary(lists:reverse(Acc))}
 2119:     after ?EXEC_TIMEOUT ->
 2120: 	    timeout
 2121:     end.
 2122: 
 2123: collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize) ->
 2124:     ct:log("~p:~p Listener ~p running! ConnectionRef=~p, ChannelId=~p",
 2125:            [?MODULE,?LINE,self(),ConnectionRef,ChannelId]),
 2126:     collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, [], 0).
 2127: 
 2128: collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum) ->
 2129:     TO = 5000,
 2130:     receive
 2131: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Data}} when is_binary(Data) ->
 2132: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p bytes. total ~p bytes,  want ~p more",
 2133: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,size(Data),Sum+size(Data),EchoSize-Sum]),
 2134:             ssh_connection:adjust_window(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, size(Data)),
 2135: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, [Data | Acc], Sum+size(Data));
 2136: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, Msg={eof, ChannelId}} ->
 2137: 	    collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize);
 2138: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, Msg={closed,ChannelId}} ->
 2139: 	    collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize);
 2140: 	Msg ->
 2141: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: ***** unexpected message *****~n~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
 2142: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum)
 2143:     after TO ->
 2144: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: ----- Nothing received for ~p seconds -----~n",[?MODULE,?LINE,TO]),
 2145: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum)
 2146:     end.
 2147: 
 2148: collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize) ->
 2149:     try
 2150: 	iolist_to_binary(lists:reverse(Acc))
 2151:     of
 2152: 	Bin ->
 2153: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p.~nGot in total ~p bytes,  want ~p more",
 2154: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,Msg,size(Bin),EchoSize,size(Bin)]),
 2155: 	    Bin
 2156:     catch
 2157: 	C:E ->
 2158: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p.~nAcc is strange...~nException=~p:~p~nAcc=~p",
 2159: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,Msg,C,E,Acc]),
 2160: 	    {error,{C,E}}
 2161:     end.
 2162: 
 2163: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------
 2164: %% This is taken from the ssh example code.
 2165: start_our_shell(_User, _Peer) ->
 2166:     spawn(fun() ->
 2167: 		  io:format("Enter command\n")
 2168: 		  %% Don't actually loop, just exit
 2169:           end).
 2170: 
 2171: start_our_shell2(_User, _Peer) ->
 2172:     spawn(fun() ->
 2173:                   io:format("Enter command\n"),
 2174:                   read_write_loop1("> ", 1)
 2175:           end).
 2176: 
 2177: ssh_exec_echo(Cmd) ->
 2178:     spawn(fun() ->
 2179:                   io:format("echo ~s\n", [Cmd])
 2180:           end).
 2181: 
 2182: ssh_exec_echo(Cmd, User) ->
 2183:     spawn(fun() ->
 2184:                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
 2185:           end).
 2186: 
 2187: receive_bytes(_, _, 0, _) ->
 2188:     ct:log("ALL DATA RECEIVED Budget = 0"),
 2189:     ct:log("================================ ExpectBudget = 0 (reception completed)"),
 2190:     ok;
 2191: receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Budget, AccSize) when Budget > 0 ->
 2192:     receive
 2193:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, D}} ->
 2194:             Fmt = "================================ ExpectBudget = "
 2195:                 "~p bytes Received/Total = ~p/~p bytes",
 2196:             Args = [Budget, byte_size(D), AccSize + byte_size(D)],
 2197:             ct:log(Fmt, Args),
 2198:             ssh_connection:adjust_window(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, size(D)),
 2199:             receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 2200:                           Budget - byte_size(D), AccSize + byte_size(D))
 2201:     after
 2202:         10000 ->
 2203:             ct:log("process_info(self(), messages) = ~p",
 2204:                    [process_info(self(), messages)]),
 2205:             ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 2206:     end.
